section: 1.3. "Distributor" means Siemens. For the purposes of clarity within this document, a Partner is classified as Siemens, its Affiliates, or any Third Party which has been granted distribution rights whose scope includes the Products and/or Services by Siemens.
explanation: The definition of "Distributor" is simply "Siemens." However, the subsequent sentence expands the definition of "Partner" to include Siemens, its Affiliates, or any Third Party with distribution rights granted by Siemens. This implies that "Partner" and "Distributor" are intended to be synonymous, yet they are defined differently. This creates confusion as to whether the terms are truly interchangeable and introduces ambiguity in the contract.

section: 1.3. "Distributor" means Siemens. For the purposes of clarity within this document, a Partner is classified as Siemens, its Affiliates, or any Third Party which has been granted distribution rights whose scope includes the Products and/or Services by Siemens.
explanation: Defining distributor as only Siemens but then providing a broad explanation of partner that involves affiliates and third parties creates ambiguity in the text and is an in-text contradiction. This may also lead to misinterpretation and confusions in other sections.

section: 3.1. Independent Vendor. Distributor shall be and must at all times make it clear that it is an independent entity contracting with Accuray, and is not the employee, representative or agent of Accuray. Distributor does not have the ability or authority to enter into any legal agreements or obligations that would bind Accuray in any manner.
explanation: This section states that the Distributor cannot enter into any legal agreements or obligations that would bind Accuray. However, other sections of the agreement, such as those dealing with sales and service agreements, imply that the Distributor does have the ability to create agreements that Accuray is obligated to fulfill. This is a contradiction because if the distributor makes a sale, Accuray is obligated to provide the product.

section: 4.1.1. Fulfillment of Executed Purchase Orders. Accuray is responsible for ensuring that the goods supplied are of good quality as further described below. Accuray will use commercially reasonable efforts to provide to Retailer or Customer, as applicable, in a timely manner those Products and Services required to fill confirmed Purchase Orders received from Distributor in accordance with the terms of this Agreement.
explanation: This section refers to providing products and services to 'Retailer or Customer, as applicable.' However, the agreement defines the relationship between Accuray and Distributor (Siemens), and the Distributor's relationship with the Customer. There is no mention of 'Retailer' anywhere else in the document. This misalignment of terminology creates confusion and an in-text contradiction, because there is no description of the party known as the Retailer.
